entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud SM: Enhancements on the Environments Screen
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community members! 

I’m excited to share the improvements made to the Environment Screen in SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud Standard Model (SAP PaPM Cloud SM). In this blog we will explore the new design, which makes working with Environments easier and more intuitive. Actions like adding, editing, moving, and deleting are now clearer, with a structured and consistent flow. There’s no need to worry about accidental deletions or remembering to save—every change is confirmed and applied instantly. The interface is cleaner, and the process feels smoother, allowing users to focus on their work without unnecessary steps. With these improvements, managing Environments is now simpler, faster, and more reliable.

Adding, Copying, and Editing in Environments Screen

Before: 

Previously, adding, copying, or editing nodes and environments was done directly within the table through inline editing. Selecting “Add Node” or “Add Environment” activated an editable row where users could input the ID, version, and description. Copying through “Environment From” pre-filled these fields with data from the selected environment, allowing further change. Editing was accessed via a pencil icon on the right side of the row, enabling users to update only the description while the ID and version remained locked. 

After: 

In the new implementation, actions such as adding, copying, and editing nodes and environments are now performed through pop-up dialogs instead of inline editing. Each dialog is labeled according to the selected action.  

Choosing “Add Node” or “Add Environment” opens a dialog where users can enter the ID, version, and description.  

Editing is now initiated from the header section, and the pop-up allows changes to the description while ID and version remain greyed out. 

Copying via “Environment From” opens a similar pop-up with pre-filled data for editing. 

Moving of Nodes and Environments

Before: 

Users can select the node or environment they wish to move, drag it, and drop it onto the available node on the screen. For instance, as illustrated in the image below, they can move the environment to one of two nodes in the same folder or to the parent node of its current location. To move it to a different node, they must first drag and drop it to a node that allows further movement to a child Node. For example, they can place it in the main folder and then continue the drag-and-drop process to reach the intended node. This method can be labor-intensive due to the manual selection of the target folder without a clear hierarchy, which may take some time.  

When the user moves to the target node, they must save the change by clicking the “Save” icon. If they make a mistake, they have “Undo” and “Redo” buttons to correct it.   

After: 

In the updated Environment Screen, once users select their desired node or environment for moving, they need to click the “Move” option in the header. This action triggers a pop-up window, allowing the user to choose their preferred node either from the dropdown menu or from the node picker.  

The default value is set to Main (Root Node). Display between the main target field and the Node Picker hierarchy is synchronized. This feature is handy for users who don’t remember the exact name of the target node but know its parent. Choosing the parent node from the dropdown will highlight it in the node picker. After that, the user can select the child node where they want to move the selected node or environment.  

After clicking the “Move” button, the node or environment will be moved to the target node, which will be opened on the Environment Screen. This action will be saved automatically.  

Deleting of Nodes and Environments

Before: 

To delete a chosen node or environment, users should click the “Delete” button located in the header. This action will instantly remove the node or environment from the user interface, but users can undo or redo the change if they wish to revert it. Finally, they must click the “Save” button to confirm their changes. After saving, the undo and redo options will no longer be available.

After: 

In the new implementation, after selecting the node or environment they want to remove, users need to click on the “Delete” button in the header. However, this time, the node or environment will not be deleted immediately. Instead, a confirmation pop-up window will appear that shows how many nodes or environments will be deleted, and users need to confirm that they really want to delete them.  

After confirmation, users will receive an information blue message toast indicating that the process has started in the backend. Then, after it’s done, they will receive a successful green message toast. These messages provide clear feedback on the process and improve user experience. 

Conclusion 

The enhancement of the Environment Screen has made it more intuitive, efficient, and consistent. By replacing inline editing and drag-and-drop with pop-up dialogs, users now have a clearer workflow that aligns with other parts of the system. 

Key changes include: 

  • Automatic saving, eliminating the need for Save, Undo, and Redo buttons 
  • Edit and Move actions relocated to the header for better accessibility 
  • Deletion confirmation dialogs, preventing unintended data loss 
  • A move option with node picker, replacing manual drag-and-drop for environment movement 

These updates reduce complexity, minimize errors, and improve navigation, making interactions more intuitive and ensuring a more efficient workflow for users.  

I hope you find these updates helpful! If you have any questions or comments, feel free to post them in the comment section.

Stay tuned for the latest updates and insights on the next one. Thank you!

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model: What’s New as of 2025-03-03?
entry.content:
Hi there!  

We are back again for another What’s New for SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud Standard Model (SAP PaPM Cloud SM). This month’s What’s New will focus on the enhancements in the Environment screen and the consolidation of Show and Analyze Screen.  

In case you missed it, you can always catch up on the latest developments and releases about SAP PaPM Cloud SM following the relevant tag: PaPMCloudWhatsNew 

Let’s start! 

Environments Screen Enhancements 

SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model has enhanced the Environments screen by replacing inline editing and drag-and-drop interactions with modal dialogs. This update streamlines actions like adding, editing, moving, and deleting environments, providing a more consistent and user-friendly experience. Additionally, automatic saving eliminates the need for manual save, undo, and redo actions. 

More details about the Environments screen enhancements can be found in the SAP PaPM Cloud blog post: SAP PaPM Cloud SM: Enhancements on the Environments Screen or visit our Application Help portal Environments screen. 

Consolidation of Show and Analyze Screen 

Two of the most frequently used screens in SAP PAPM Cloud Standard Model application, Show and Analyze screens, have been consolidated into one unique screen. Displaying and maintaining data in tabular view in Show screen and manipulating data in aggregated view in Analyze screen is now merged into single Data maintenance screen.  
For your reference, please visit Show screen and Analyze data sections in the Application Help portal. 

Access to the Consolidated Show & Analyze Screen 

Previously, authorized users could access and maintain data in the Show and Analyze screens through two different buttons.

With the new implementation, Show and Analyze screens are merged into one screen, which can be accessed via the Manage Data button.  

Upon accessing the Show screen of any function, the URL part isPivotModeOn states if the pivoted mode is enabled. In case authorized users wish to view and maintain data in tabular view they can keep the Pivot toggle disabled.

Once users wish to change the data representation from tabular to aggregated view, they can enable the Pivot toggle. 

Layouts for different pivot modes are separated, which means that the user can save different set of layouts for two different pivot modes: enabled and disabled.  

In case user makes any changes in the Show screen with disabled pivot mode , an asterisk indicator (*) will show up besides the current layout. Upon trying to enable the Pivot toggle, the user will get a warning message that unsaved changes for current mode will be discarded in case user chooses to leave the view. 

The same behavior will be applicable if the user tries to disable the Pivot toggle while they are in pivot mode with unsaved layout changes. 

That’s it for now! 
Stay tuned for more enhancements and exciting release in the next months’ What’s New. 
Until next time and see you next month!

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Universal Model: What’s New as of 2025-03-03?
entry.content:
Hey everyone, SAP Community members!

March is here, ready to see what's new and improved in SAP PaPM Cloud UM? Let me walk you through all the latest features and enhancements for SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud – Universal Model (SAP PaPM Cloud UM)

If you want to catch up the previous blog posts from my colleague, you can always go through and read them all using this tag PaPMCloudUMWhatsNew .

Let’s begin!

Model

Validation for Rule Result Field

Some of the functions in PaPM, such as Derivation, Model Derivation, Calculation and Model Calculation, have this feature called Rule Result Field. This is an optional setting that allows the user to define a string field that will contain the rule ID of a specific rule that is being used, and it will be shown in the Data Screen. Having that in place, a field that is already assigned to the Rule Result Field can no longer be used in the Assignments section of any rule. A validation error will be encountered for this kind of scenario

Manage Activities, Manage Reports and Manage Pages

Data Authorization in Dynamic Rule and Rule Element

An enhancement has been introduced in relation on maintaining dynamic rule in activity’s Show Rule screen and in Show Report and Show Page Rule Element. 

This enhancement affects activity, report and page users as there will be an additional data authorization applied when maintaining dynamic rules. The user will only be now authorized to create and maintain rules based on the data authorization they have from the Activity Field Selection on Show, Data Privilege and Data Locks configuration. 

When users access the activity’s Show Rule screen, Show Report and Show Page (Rule Element), the user will only be able to view and manage rules based on the assigned data authorization to the user. 

With assigned role authorization (PROCESS_ALL and/or REPORT_ALL), the user will be able to create a dynamic rule for all data and view all existing rules.
In addition to that, the user will also be able to view all data from the Input and Result tabs. 

Manage Activities > Show Rules

Manage Reports > Show Report

Manage Pages > Show Page

Then, if the user has data authorization restrictions, for example, the user is only authorized to read and write the String field data for values between “String 01” – “String 04", the user will only be able to create dynamic rule for the specific data set and view existing rules related to it. 
In addition to that, the user will only be able to view the data they have authorization in the Input and Result tabs.

Manage Activities > Show Rules

Manage Reports > Show Report

Manage Pages > Show Page

Inline Editing of Show Elements in Reports

During this month, we enhanced inline editing of reports’ show elements. Similarly in the Data Screen, you can now perform the following:

  • Edit or Delete multiple records at once, making it easier to apply changes across several entries.
  • Edit or Delete or Create subitems directly within the show element

This enhancement makes it easier to work with data directly in Reports screen, without navigating into separate pages.
Here’s a quick look at the new functionality:

A new Edit/Delete icon (called Show Actions) has been introduced in the top right of show element, when editing mode is switched on.

When clicked, it displays a panel with two options:

  • Edit
  • Delete

This enables users to efficiently manage multiple records directly within the Show screen, following the same logic applied in individual elements.

  1. Multi-Editing Capabilities
  • Choose the Edit button to edit multiple records at once.
  • Editable fields are displayed as input fields, allowing users to modify values within the grid.
  • Subitems can be edited (also created and deleted) in the same screen.
  • Changes can be saved individually or in bulk using the Save All or Discard All buttons.

2. Deleting Records

  • Choose the Delete button to remove selected records from the dataset.
  • A confirmation step is required before the deletion is applied.

Hidden Condition Logic

Please note that the same hidden condition logic that applies in the standard Data Screen is enforced now in Reports’ Show Element.

  • If a field is configured to be hidden under specific conditions:
  • The field will not be displayed in the edit panel.
  • The hidden status dynamically updates based on dependencies (e.g., if one field’s value determines another field’s visibility).

NOTE: Hidden Conditions are settings that let users define rules to show or hide specific data records or fields based on predefined criteria. If a field meets the specified conditions, it will be hidden or displayed in the edit panel accordingly. The visibility of a field updates dynamically based on dependencies—for example, if one field’s value controls another field’s visibility, the system automatically adjusts it when the value changes.

 Hidden conditions can be configured within the Adapt UI feature, which is accessible from the Data Screen.

That’s it for now!

I hope this new feature and enhancement makes your work with SAP PaPM UM better. Stay tuned for more “What’s New” post, coming in every first week of the Month. Share this blogpost with your colleagues and friends. Thank you!

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model – Cron expression for Process Scheduler
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community!

This blogpost for the SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud – Standard Model (SAP PaPM Cloud SM) will introduce the enhancement of our Process Scheduler. As you have read in the last blogpost of 2024 Recurring Process and Multi-Selection of Activities in Process Scheduler, we have introduced the improvements of the Process Scheduler with regards to scheduling a job in recurring scenarios and being able to select multiple activities.

We are happy to announce the latest improvements in the Process Scheduler which we are adding the cron format of scheduling a job to accommodate our customers' needs . To support this feature, we have added a new field called Schedule Type, where users can select between One Time, Repeat Interval and Cron type for job scheduling. Let’s take a look at these different schedule types below:

One Time
This schedule type is basically almost the original state of the Process Scheduler when it was initially introduced in this blogpost Process Scheduler: Execution made easy by Scheduling a “Job” in SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud which allows the user to configure a one-time job. Moreover, you are now capable of selecting multiple activities inside the process template/process instance that will run sequentially as introduced in the recent enhancement. Here’s how to create a job using One Time schedule type.

After maintaining the fields and choosing CONFIRM button, the created job will be visible in the job list panel with “Scheduled” state.

Once the planned launch date and time is reached, the state of the job will be in “Completed” status while the Run Status and the Result in the job details panel will be populated.

Repeat Interval
This schedule type was the enhancement we have mentioned in this blogpost Recurring Process and Multi-Selection of Activities in Process Scheduler - we can schedule a job in recurring scenario using Human-Readable Date Formats. Here's what it looks like:

In this job example, we are scheduling a recurring job of every 5 minutes from 16:25 to 16:35 which will give us a total of 3 runs. After selecting the CONFIRM button, the job will be created with the "Scheduled" status and the "Repeat Interval" column will be populated with the schedule parameter we maintained in the "Add Process Schedule" dialogue. After the "Active Until" date and time was reached, the state of the job will be in "Completed" state and all the runs will be updated with run status and results. 

Spoiler
Note: If the "Active Until" field is not maintained, the job will run indefinitely or until the job has been deleted in the Process Scheduler screen.

Cron
This schedule type was introduced to accommodate scheduling of jobs recurrently in a more complex way. You may refer to this documentation to know more about using Cron Format.

The Cron schedule type will introduce the following new fields:

  1. XS Cron Expression - This is a free text field to which the users can input their cron expressions (In the example above, it means the job will run every hour at 12:00 to 09:00 UTC between Mondays to Fridays).
  2. Active Since - Specify the date and time when the scheduled job will start running. This field is not mandatory. If left blank, the first recurrence will be schedule at the earliest possible time after the job creation according to the maintained cron expression. 
  3. Active Until - Specify the date and time when the scheduled job will stop running. This field is also not mandatory. If left blank, the job will be running indefinitely, or until deleted.
Spoiler
IMPORTANT! Cron uses the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). If you are to use Cron as schedule type, the time that you have to enter in the cron expression field should be in UTC. 

If you want to use Cron but do not know how to write one, we got you covered! You can use the "Generate Basic XS Cron Expression" picker beside the XS Cron Expression field . This option is introduced to help our beginner users to use this schedule type. Bear in mind that the picker cannot do all the combinations that technical users can produce manually. Since it is a free text field, after you have generated a cron expression using the picker, you can still edit the cron expression according to your requirements. You can pick from Daily, Weekly, Monthly and Yearly options. Let's talk about it one by one. 

Daily
If you choose Daily as frequency, it will run everyday at a given time. As shown below, I'm choosing to run the job daily at 08:00. 

Since my system time is in UTC+08:00, when I hit CONFIRM, the generated Cron expression will be scheduled at 12:00 UTC. 

Weekly
If you choose weekly as frequency, you can run a job in a specific time and day/days of the week. For my example below, I will run the job at 18:00 every Monday, Wednesday and Friday. Please see below:

The generated cron expression will look like this. 

Again, it does not look like I chose 18:00 as the maintained time but 10:00 since the cron generator will automatically convert the maintained system time to UTC time. 

Monthly
If we choose monthly as frequency, you can run a job in a specific time in specific day/days of the month. In my example below, I want to run a job at 18:00 every 1st, 10th, 15th, 20th and 30th day of the month. 

The generated cron expression will look like this:

Yearly
If you choose yearly as frequency, you can choose the specific time, months and days of the month accordingly. In my example below, I want to run my job on the 1st, 15th and 30th of January, June and December at 18:00. 

The generated cron will look like this:

After selecting the CONFIRM button, the state of the job will be in "Scheduled" state and the XS Cron Expression column header will show the maintained cron expression.

And there you have it. Like and share this blog post with your colleagues who may be interested in this new feature. This information is also available in our Application Help. 

Thank you!

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model: What’s New as of 2025-04-07?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community members! 

I am glad that I can bring to you the newest updates related to SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model for the month of March. 

Let’s dive into the latest updates! 

System > Process Scheduler  

SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model has enhanced the Process Scheduler by adding Schedule Type field to help our users to select on a specific scheduling type. The options that users can select are One Time, Repeat Interval, and Cron schedule types.    

More details about the Process Scheduler enhancements can be found in the SAP PaPM Cloud blogpost: SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model – Cron expression for Process Scheduler or visit our Application Help portal Process Scheduler 

Administration > Settings 

We are integrating SAP Cloud Transport Management (SAP cTMS) into Application Shell Integration Settings within SAP Profitability and Performance Management (SAP PaPM) to enhance user experience by providing quick and seamless access to SAP cTMS directly from SAP PaPM.  

To learn more about this setting, please refer to the Application Help through this link.  
Want to dive deeper into SAP cTMS? Feel free to check out this SAP PAPM Cloud SM integration with SAP cTMS blogpost. 

User Preferences  

Good news for Users in Poland, Polish language is now supported by SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model App.   

For more information visit User Preferences in Application Help Portal.  

Modeling > Remote Function Adapter  

To improve functionality and prevent unintended changes, we have refined the editing capabilities in the RFA mapping sheet for all RFA function types.  

Now, only the "Value" column is editable, while all others remain fixed to prevent errors and ensure stability of the Application.  

 

I hope you enjoyed this blog post and found it helpful in learning about the new features in SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model. 

To stay updated with our previous posts on the latest developments and features in SAP PaPM Cloud SM, check out the tag PaPMCloudWhatsNew, which archives all related content. 

Thank you and stay tuned for the future What's New series!

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model – Introducing Team Collection
entry.content:
Hello dear SAP Community readers!

As part of continuous enhancements in SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud Standard Model (SAP PaPM Cloud SM) to be able to provide a seamless experience and flexibility to its users, let me give you the latest feature enhancement in the Teams application.

Currently, users can only assign one team as a Performer or Reviewer in process activities in Process Management which is somehow limited in case multiple teams are needed for process reviews. Apart from this, users still have to assign multiple teams across SAP PaPM Cloud SM applications such as Environments Access Management and in Reader/Writer team for analytic privileges. Even though this remains functional, users are seeking extra flexibility in teams management.

With the new implementation, users can now create a team collection that can contain child teams. This new feature is especially helpful when users are already part of a team but also need to be included in other teams for specific applications.

This also means that all the child teams will dynamically adapt the access or authorizations of their parent team. Furthermore, it gives the users the flexibility to assign multiple teams as a team collection to Performer/Reviewer in Process Management or Reader/Writer for analytic privileges instead of assigning multiple single teams. 

To show you this amazing new feature enhancement, let's start with the new UI in Teams application. Upon accessing the Teams screen, you will see the new column “Child Teams” in Teams panel. In the Child Teams column, it will simply display all the child teams of the parent team.

 

Creation of Team Collection

The creation of a team collection can be done by adding a single or multiple child teams to a Team.

To add a child team:
  1. In the Teams application, select an existing team from the Teams list.
  2. Choose the Edit button.
  3. Under Child Teams section, click on the dropdown.
  4. Choose one or more teams from the list.
  5. Choose Confirm.
    Spoiler
    The child team added in a team will be automatically visible under the Child Teams column in the form of a hyperlink. Once clicked, it will allow the user to focus or display the specific child team.

After successful creation of a team collection, it is ready to be used in applications such as Environments Access as Authorized Teams, Reader/Writer teams for analytic privileges, and Performer/Reviewer teams in process activities.

The user can also add a new team collection as follows:
  1. In the Teams application, choose the Add button from the Teams panel.
  2. Define Name and Description of the team.
  3. Under Child Teams section, click on the dropdown.
  4. Choose team/s from the list.
  5. Choose Confirm.
  6. Optionally, the user can add users to the created team collection by adding users in Users panel.

The user can remove/unlink the child team from a specific team collection via the Edit Team button and simply remove the child team from the list. In any case, if all child teams of the team collection were removed, the team collection can still exist as a regular team.

To remove/unlink child teams:
  1. In the Teams application, select an existing team collection.
  2. Choose the Edit button from the Teams panel.
  3. Under Child Teams section, remove the child teams.
  4. Choose Confirm.Note: The removed/unlinked child teams will no longer have the access or authorization of the parent team and will just exist independently.
Adding Team Collection as child team:

In addition, a team collection can also be a child of another team or multiple teams, which makes it more versatile as shown below.

Note: Circular Parent-Child relationship is not possible wherein a parent team cannot be assigned to its child team (ex. Team X1 is a child of Team X and Team X is a child of Team X1).

 

Assigning and Managing Team Collection in Applications

Prerequisites: Create team collections.

For example:

Team CollectionChild Teams
TEAM ATEAM1
TEAM2
TEAM BTEAM3
Environments Access Screen

The created team collection can now be used as Authorized Teams in private environments.

  1. In the Environments Access screen, choose an environment.
  2. Choose the Edit Access for Environment(s) button from the header.
  3. Choose Private, then assign TEAM A as Authorized Teams.
  4. Choose Confirm.

In this scenario, parent TEAM A with child teams TEAM1 and TEAM2 will have access to the private environment, while TEAM B will not be able to see the private environment.

Note: Users should not have ENVIRONMENTS_ACCESS_ALL role.

The parent TEAM B with child team TEAM3 will not have access to the private environment.

Reader and Writer Teams in Master Data with Analytic Privileges

The created team collection can now be used as Reader and Writer in master data with analytic privileges.

  1. In the Modeling screen, choose a Characteristic field with master data.
  2. Assign the team collection as Reader and Writer in master data values as per below.
  3. Choose Save. 
  4. Access the Input/Output activity (Editable Query).

In this scenario, TEAM A will be able to view and update on the data rows with CUST1, CUST2 and CUST3.
While TEAM B will be able to view and update on the data rows with CUST4 and CUST5. Users that are not part of the Reader and Writer is expected to not see any data rows.

For more info, you may visit related blog post SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud: Analytic Privileges

Process Management

The users can have the capability to assign multiple teams in a team collection and assign as Performer and Reviewer in process activities. The teams that are part of the performer and reviewer will also receive the email notifications for every activity action.

  1. In the Process Management screen, choose or create a process instance.
  2. Assign team collections below in all process activities.
    Performer: TEAM A
    Reviewer:  TEAM B
    For example: 
  3. Choose Save.

    Note: The users that are part of the team should enable Email Notifications via User Preferences to be able to receive emails.

In this scenario, users part of TEAM A (Performer) can perform Submit activity and users that are part of TEAM B (Reviewer) can perform Reject/Approve the activities.

  1. User part of TEAM A (child team: TEAM1) can perform submit and receive email notification.
  2. User part of TEAM A (child team: TEAM2) can perform submit and receive email notification.
  3. User part of TEAM B (child team: TEAM3) can perform approval and receive email notification.

If you want to learn more about dual control mechanism in SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model, you may visit this related blog post SAP PaPM Cloud Dual Control Mechanism & Process Instance Filtering

For more information, you may check our Standard Model Application Help: Teams 

That’s it! I hope you find this new feature enhancement useful and your work with SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model better and stay tuned for more related blog posts, you may also check the same feature in SAP PaPM Cloud - Universal Model via SAP PaPM Cloud Universal Model: What’s New as of 2024-12-12?

See you on the next one!

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Universal Model: What’s New as of 2025-04-03?
entry.content:
Hello, SAP users!  

We’re excited to share the latest updates to the SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud – Universal Model (SAP PaPM Cloud UM). These new features are designed to make processes smoother, improve decision-making, and boost performance.  

Whether you're a long-time user or just getting started, these updates bring valuable enhancements to help you achieve better results. 

If you want to catch up on previous updates, check out our past blog posts here - https://community.sap.com/t5/tag/PaPMCloudUMWhatsNew/tg-p. 

 Let’s take a look at what’s new this month!  

Model

Manage Environment

User can now choose how to deactivate environment:  

  • Option #1 (Current deactivation process): All flags are set to “Yes”;
  • Option #2 (New): All flags are set to “No”;
  • Option #3 (New): Only the “Delete all dependent data” flag is set to “Yes”, while all other flags remain “No”. 

Users can now deactivate environments with All flags set to No. This is a new behavior of Deactivation process. After doing so, environment’s state is set to ‘Inactive’. However, this deactivated environment using All options set to “No” cannot be removed. Not until all dependencies are removed. To remove all dependencies, user needs to reactivate the environment, then deactivate it with All flags set to ‘Yes! 

In addition, one more scenario is also possible: to deactivate environment with the delete data only set to “Yes” and all other flags are set to “No”. In this case, environment state is set to ‘Not Current’. Also, this deactivated environment cannot be removed! However, to set the environment to inactive, user can set all flags to ‘Yes’ and then user can already remove the environment. 

This change provides more flexibility to modeling —especially during planning cycles, testing scenarios, or model shifts.

 

Manage Environment - Model Screen

Navigation to the Show Screen is now possible through the hierarchy list, so you no longer need to access it only from the Network tab. This link can be found in the Hierarchy table and will only be visible if the environment is activated.

Additionally, a context menu is available in the Hierarchy. Simply right-click to execute actions such as Run, Show Details or Attributes of a function, Show Data, Copy, and Delete. This provides an alternative way to streamline your workflow.

 

Manage Model View

A new validation has been implemented for Model View field configuration if there’s a relation/deep nested field is used or defined as an Input Field in the Fields section.  

The Input Field is being defined in the Fields section of Model View as this field is coming from the input that can be processed further. It means that the user can further perform aggregation, exclude it from the result, map it to another field or perform a value selection.  

If a relation/deep nested field is added but no selection is defined/maintained, it cannot be excluded (Exclude checkbox) as it doesn’t make any data enrichment. This field does not originate from the Model View's Input Function at first, and thus not required to be added in the Field configuration if no additional data enrichment is needed.  

With this, if this scenario is being performed during configuration, upon saving the function, a validation message will prompt stating “Excluding Nested field is redundant. Please remove the entry”.  

This was introduced to avoid system failures, for example case when activation of Environment that contains Model View Type: Projection which uses field from Inherited Relation that has configuration Exclude = Yes (checked) results to failed.

 

 

Manage Model Calculation

From previous enhancements of Manage Calculations Functions the Edit button was introduced on the Assignment section of Rules. This button aids the user to easily maintain a formula in the editor as it provides suggestions of keywords. During the initial release of the functionality, the user waits for some time before the suggested words appear. 

A major aspect of the enhancement is the increased response time of the system and after this, words now appear immediately while the user types a string in the formula editor. 

 

Report

Manage Reports - Tile Element

Inspired by the role-based experience of SAP Fiori Launchpad, this update brings to reports a familiar tile-based element. Whether you're surfacing critical data, linking to important content, or simply organizing information visually—Tile Elements help you do it with elegance and precision. 

Creating and Editing the Tile 

  • New button labeled “Insert Tile Element” is available in Page Edit Mode;
  • Clicking the “Insert Tile Element” button opens  “Create Tile Element” dialog. The dialog allows the user to configure the tile with: title, description and icon (all optional). 

Upon creation, user can: 

  • edit the tile by adding/changing name & description, that is will be displayed in the tile;
  • add text and/or any report element (show element, data element, rule element, reference) inside the tile;
  • add reference;
  • re-size the tile;
  • delete the tile.

Tile Display Logic when reference is assigned: 

  • If a semantic link reference is assigned, the tile is displayed on Report only if the referenced page is visible to the user. (if tile is referenced to the page user does not have access to, the tile will not be visible for the user),
  • Clicking the tile navigates the user to the assigned reference target. 

 

User 1 Accessing Reports (tile is visible)


User 2 Accessing Reports (tile is not visible)

 

That’s it for now!

I hope this new feature and enhancement makes your work with SAP PaPM UM better. Stay tuned for more “What’s New” post. Share this blogpost with your colleagues and friends. Thank you!

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Universal Model: What’s New as of 2025-05-05?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community! 

May has arrived, and it's time to explore what’s fresh and enhanced in SAP PaPM Cloud UM. I'm here to guide you through the latest updates and new features in SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud – Universal Model (SAP PaPM Cloud UM). 

If you’d like to revisit earlier updates shared by my colleague, feel free to browse all past blog posts using the PaPMCloudUMWhatsNew tag. 

Let’s start! 

 Model

 Prefer currency field master data over SAP common currencies in Allocation/Model Allocation 

In the SAP PaPM Cloud UM application the decimal places for currencies that are automatically being assigned to an amount is defined on the Standard table SAP Common Currencies.   

A new feature is introduced so that the user can define as master data/association field how many decimal places an amount has for a certain currency.   

The following steps are to be carried out to use this enhancement  

  1. Create a Model Entity.  
  2. Assign a key figure field with type small integer and assign a value help tag Currency Scale. The Currency Scale value help tag identifies a key figure field with small integer type that it is to be used as the decimal place of the amount. 
  3. Create an Association Field for the Model Entity so that it can act as currency master data.  
  4. As for the data, assign a number for the key figure from number 2 that will serve as a decimal place holder. 

 

      5. Assign the created Association field from step 3 on a model entity that is using an Amount field. The Association field will now adapt the decimal places defined using the Currency Scale Value help tag.

Note that if a certain currency is not part of the master data it will adapt the decimal places defined on Standard table SAP Common Currencies. 

Model Screen

   Inline Data Preview – Feature Description

The Inline Data Preview feature is now available in both and Hierarchy views, offering users the ability to preview and interact with data directly within their current workflow.

For Network and Hierarchy, please refer to our SAP Help Portal --> Network | SAP Help Portal and Hierarchy | SAP Help Portal.

Activation

  • A new Settings Menu is available in the Model Screen.
  • From this menu, users can toggle Inline Data Preview ON or OFF.

Functionality

  • When Inline Data Preview is enabled and a function is selected in Network or Hierarchy view, a Show Element panel becomes available at the bottom of the screen.
  • This Show Element provides functionality like the Show Element in the Report Screen, including:
    • Toggle Buttons to switch between Embedded Mode and Full Mode.
    • An option to open the Show Screen in a separate browser tab.
    • Access to Show Actions.

Event Logs Tab

  • The Show Element includes an Event Logs tab.
  • This tab displays relevant logs for the selected function, helping users track activity and troubleshoot as needed.

Data Editing

If data is editable in the Show Screen, it is also editable in the Show Element within the Inline DataPreview.

Delete improvements

The “Delete” option should appear in the context menu only when it is applicable to the selected node.

Specifically, it should not be shown for:

  • Fulfilled folders, or
  • Nodes that are used as input functions

 Show Screen

   Enhanced Event Log Filtering with Multi-Selection Capability

We have improved the Event Logs section in the Data Screen to significantly enhance user experience when analyzing the lifecycle or history of records. Previously users could only select one Event Type at a time or choose "All," which often cluttered the view with irrelevant entries (e.g., numerous READ events), making detailed analysis cumbersome. 

Now: 

  • Multi-Selection Enabled: Users can now select multiple Event Types simultaneously (e.g., CREATE, UPDATE, DELETE) using the Event Type filter available under Additional Filters in the Event Logs panel. 
  • Streamlined Record Review: The Event Logs list dynamically responds to the selected Event Types, displaying only the events that matter most to you. 
  • "All" Option Remains Available: For broader analysis, users can still opt to display all events. 
  • Default Selection: By default, the Event Type filter pre-selects the most critical Event Types—CREATE, UPDATE, and DELETE—ensuring a cleaner, more relevant initial view without requiring manual adjustments. 

User Benefits: 

  • Focus only on important record changes without distraction from less critical events. 
  • Save time by avoiding repetitive manual filtering. 

  Drill Down into Key Figures with Detail Data Display in Pivot Mode

We’re excited to introduce a powerful enhancement —Detail Data Display in Pivot Mode in Data Screen. This new feature gives you deeper insights into your data by allowing you to explore the individual records behind aggregated values directly from the pivot screen, since understanding what contributes to your KPIs is just as important as seeing the number itself. With this enhancement, you no longer have to guess where figures come from—you can now see the exact detail records that make up any aggregated value, right from the report view. 

Key Highlights 

  1. Clickable Key Figures 

In Pivot Mode, all key figures are now displayed as interactive links. Simply click on any value to reveal the detail records that contribute to it. 

  1. Contextual Detail Records 

Once clicked, a second show screen appears at the bottom of the report. This display applies all: 

  • Show screen filters, 
  • Dimension values from column labels and row groups, and 
  • The correct aggregation logic (e.g., SUM) 

The total result of this list always matches the original key figure—ensuring complete transparency and accuracy. 

  1. Additional Data Analysis 

You can also perform additional data analysis by  

  • applying filters to second show element with detailed data  
  • and creating pivot mode aggregation  
  1. Search with Ease 

A full-text search tool in the detail display enables quick filtering across all visible fields—perfect for zeroing in on specific transactions or records. 

  1. Persistent Layout 

Your customized view matters. The system remembers your layout preferences, including the state and size of the detail section, and restores them next time you access the screen. 

What This Means for Users 

This update is designed to: 

  • Enhance data transparency, 
  • Improve root cause analysis, 
  • Support faster decision-making, and 
  • Eliminate the need to switch between screens or perform manual lookups. 

Whether you’re analyzing financial reports, auditing activities, or exploring operational KPIs, this feature simplifies the journey from summary to detail in just one click. 

 Default Expansion of Parent-Child Records in Layouts 

Layouts now store and restore the expanded state of parent-child records (business objects) automatically when loading Data Screens. 

Key Benefits: 

  • Efficiency: No need to manually expand records after each screen load. 
  • Consistency: Screens reopen exactly as configured, saving time and effort. 
  • Improved Usability: Enhanced navigation when working with hierarchical data structures. 

How It Works: 

  1. Expand the desired parent-child records during layout setup. 
  2. Save the layout. 
  3. Upon reopening, the system automatically applies the stored expanded or collapsed state. 

 Process

  Creation of Team based on User Email 

In the Manage Event Logs, user email address is automatically added to the list under User Teams. 

This means that users can now also create a Team in Manage Teams screen based on user email address. In addition, the Team attribute in Manage Teams during its creation can now be composed of up to 253 characters of lowercase and uppercase letters, numbers and/or special characters (“_”, “-”, “.”, and “@”) with no space in between. 

On the other hand, creation of Team mapped to SAP BTP User Attribute is still possible. 

For more information about Teams, you may check our Application Help for Universal Model: Manage Teams. 

  Report

   Default Expansion of Parent-Child Records in Layouts in Show Element

We can also change the layout to see the expanded state of parent-child records (business objects) in embedded Show Elements. Just the same as in Data Screen. 

Key Benefits: 

  • Efficiency: No need to manually expand records after each screen load. 
  • Consistency: Screens reopen exactly as configured, saving time and effort. 
  • Improved Usability: Enhanced navigation when working with hierarchical data structures. 

How It Works: 

  1. When setting up the data in Show Element, expand the desired parent-child records  
  1. Save the Element. 

Upon reopening, the system automatically applies the stored expanded or collapsed state. 

  Reference Link to Show Screen

You can now create reference links to Data Screens (with Layouts) directly in your reports! 

Enhancement Details: 

  • A new tab called “Show Functions” has been added to the Reference Dialog. 

  • This tab allows users to easily configure a link to any layout of Data Screen of a specific function. 
  • It provides a flexible way to direct report users to a predefined Data Screen view, enhancing navigation and usability across the system. 

Key Benefits: 

  • Faster navigation: Direct users to specific Data Screens without manual searching. 
  • Streamlined reporting: Embed meaningful links into reports for quicker insights. 
  • Customization: Choose both the function and layout you want the link to point to. 

How It Works: 

  1. Open the Reference Dialog while configuring your report. 
  2. Switch to the new Show Functions tab. 
  3. Select the Function and the Layout you want to reference. 
  4. Insert the link into your report content. 

  Citation Feature for Joule Responses

Joule now offers a Citation Feature to enhance transparency and build greater trust in generated responses! 

Enhancement Details: 

  • Citations (Sources) are now displayed alongside Joule’s responses and follow-up questions. 
  •  Citations are shown in clear, user-readable text. 
  • Interactive experience: Clicking on a citation highlights the corresponding source element on the page. 
  • Citations are visually formatted to be clearly distinguishable and user-friendly. 

Key Benefits: 

  • Transparency: Easily verify the sources behind Joule's responses. 
  • Better user experience: Quickly navigate to supporting sources without confusion. 
  • Improved accuracy: Each citation is tied to the exact part of the response it supports. 

How It Works: 

  1. When Joule generates a response or follow-up question, citations will appear alongside it. 
  2. Each citation is clickable, taking you directly to the referenced source element. 
  3. Citations are formatted cleanly, making it easy to differentiate sources from the main content. 

That’s all for this update!

We hope these new features and enhancements help you get even more out of SAP PaPM UM. Don’t forget to check back during the first week of each month for the latest “What’s New” posts. If you find this helpful, feel free to share it with your colleagues and network. Thanks for reading!

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model: 3 Things You Need to Know About the Update in Email Notifications
entry.content:
Hello SAP community members!

This article is intended as a newsletter for all our SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud Standard Model (SAP PaPM Cloud SM) users, providing you with the three important information you need to know on the most recent change to email notification services.

Without further ado, let’s get started!

1. What are the updates in email notifications?

  • Email sender – instead of PAPM@sap.com the sender will now be papm@notifications.sap.com
  • Email contents – an update to the email content which will provide a clearer and more user-readable text.

See examples below:

Subscribing or unsubscribing from email notifications:

Activity Status Report (Open, Completed, Rejected, and Approved)

2. What does this update mean to our SAP PaPM Cloud SM solution?

To align with SAP's email handling capabilities, we are now transitioning from the using the current SAP SMTP service to a new solution, ANS (Alert Notification Service).

This change will automatically be applied in your SAP PaPM Cloud SM solution; however, it is important to take note that there are certain regions which will not be supported with this transition due to the absence of a built-in Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) service.

See Notification Settings help portal for the list of regions.

BUT DO NOT WORRY!

💡 Important: If your tenant is residing in these regions and would need to have an email notification service enabled, simply proceed to number 3.

3. How will I enable email notifications in my tenant if my region is not supported with this update?

For SAP PaPM Cloud SM tenants that are residing in regions that are not supported with this update, you may enable your email notifications by following the steps below:

  • Create Mail Destination in SAP BTP
  • Configure Destination in Standard Model

Did you know that you can still use your own email notification service instead of the default one provided by SAP PaPM Cloud SM? You can configure your own email notification service, which will take priority over the built-in service.

After enabling the email destination in BTP and in Standard Model application, the email sender will remain as, PAPM@sap.com but the email content will be the same. That easy!

I hope this blogpost provided you with enough information that you need to know about the latest email notification changes in SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model.

Thank you for reading!

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model: Modeling Update (Join)
entry.content:
For all SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud – Standard Model (SAP PaPM Cloud SM) modelers, get ready to experience environment modeling like never before! We're incredibly excited to unveil our latest upgrade, packed with innovative features designed to provide better user experience and satisfaction!

In this blogpost allow me to guide you through the latest upgrade in Modeling screen starting with the Join function. The goal is not only to provide a more user-friendly interface but also to enable a faster navigation through function configuration.

Ready to supercharge your modeling experience? Let’s get started!

As the title suggests, this Modeling screen upgrade will start in Join function. As you already know, in our Join function we have different nodes such as: Input, Signature, Join Rules, and Checks. Now, the nodes such as Input, Signature, and Checks will be in Properties panel, leaving only the Join Rules node in the Join function itself.

Let’s go through the highlight of the new functionalities that a modeler can maximize in these upgrades.

Just like before, Input Function and Input (for field) still works with dropdown functionality and the Complex Selections option in Input still works with Edit Calculation button if a complex selection needs to be maintained. 

The cool added functionality now is, when a specific field needs to have a Formula or a Value Selection, you can use the Edit (Edit Selection & Mapping) button which will give you the ability to maintain the needed formula and selection just like in the old days 😉

You might also have noticed already these two buttons next to the Input?

Yes! This is one of the features that we added in this enhancement. These are the new Copy and Paste buttons which will allow the users to copy a created field inside the modeling and paste it into this specific section. How cool is that? These Copy and Paste buttons are also located and can be maximized in Signature and Checks.

And do not worry, the dropdown functionality is still in place if the user wants to manually choose fields to be maintained in either Granularity, Selection, or Actions Fields. How cool is that!

Finally, in Checks, not only is it now easier to copy and paste the checks in the Properties panel, but modelers can also maximize the use of the new Checks dropdown option!

Checks are now grouped, so modelers will have an easy way to identify which check to select before running the function instead of expanding the checks node. Now that’s convenient!

Except for these user interface updates to the Input, Signature, and Checks nodes, everything else will stay the same, including the configuration of the Join Rules,  Since all our previous setups will continue to function, modelers don't need to take any additional action.

I hope this blogpost provides you with helpful information about this first modeling screen upgrade. Soon, this upgrade will also be applied to all functions so that modelers will have a faster and easier modeling experience! To know which function is next, you can visit our What’s New series where we announce new features and upgrades for SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud – Standard Model! Thank you for reading!

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model: What’s New as of 2025-06-09?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community members!

Here again to give you the latest updates in SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud – Standard Model. From Modeling screen, Administration screens such as: Teams and Settings, and Show Screen (Pivot Mode = On).

Without further ado, Let’s dive into What’s New in SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model.

 

Modeling

1. New mapping fields are now available for RFA FI-GL and RFA FI-GLI

As of today, Remote Function Adapter types, Finance General Ledger and Finance General Ledger Items, now have both Financial Period and Tax Code fields which modelers can now use when posting documents.

Finance General Ledger

header-fis_periodFiscal Period
accountgl[ 1 ]-tax_codeTax on Sales/Purchases Code
accountgl[ 2 ]-tax_codeTax on Sales/Purchases Code

Finance General Ledger Items

header-fis_periodFiscal Period
accountgl-tax_codeTax on Sales/Purchases Code

2. Modeling Update (Join)

For SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model modelers, get ready to experience the environment modeling like never before! We're incredibly excited to unveil our latest upgrade, packed with innovative features designed to provide better user experience and satisfaction! For full details about this update, visit SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model: Modeling Update (Join)

 

Show Screen (Pivot Mode = On)

As we know, when the pivot mode is set to "On" in the Show screen, the can show the totals for a particular column.

As an addition to this feature, users will now be able to customize the "Result" label for totals by following the simple steps below.

  1. Choose the column header option
  2. Choose Change Aggregation Label and adjust the label text
  3. and then choose Confirm

 

Teams

As part of the continuous enhancement to have flexibility in team management, the team collection which can contain child teams is now possible in the application. 

For the configuration and more info, you may refer to SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model – Introducing Team Collection blogpost.

 

Settings Screen

1. Email Notifications Update

To align with SAP's email handling capabilities, we are now transitioning from the current SAP SMTP service to a new solution, ANS (Alert Notification Service). For the full details, visit this blogpost SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model: 3 Things You Need to Know About the Update in Email Notifications

This update also includes user interface improvements which will provide admin with the ability to choose the configured destination from BTP in the Settings screen.

2. For role collection ADMIN_USER_RESTRICTED, we introduced a small change in its restriction to provide more secure granularity in which this role collection will now not have the ability to perform any password activities such as reset or unlock of the current database user password.

ADMIN_USER_RESTRICTED

This change does not affect other role collections such as:

SETTINGS and ADMIN_USER_ALL

The SETTINGS_READ role will remain the same with read-only access to the Administration Settings screen.

3. SAP Cloud ALM Integration in PaPM Cloud Standard Model

We're excited to announce the integration of SAP Profitability and Performance Management (PaPM) Cloud Standard Model with SAP Cloud ALM. This integration allows you to monitor the health of your PaPM application in one place.

To use this integration, you need to be subscribed to SAP PaPM Cloud and SAP Cloud ALM. The integration focuses on health monitoring, and you can track key aspects like:

  • Connection Monitoring: Checks if PaPM can connect to the database.
  • Availability Monitoring: Confirms the database is running and logs any errors.

In the Administration Settings screen, you can define which destination, previously configured for SAP Cloud ALM in SAP BTP, will be used in PaPM. This new option is available in the "Destination Settings" section. You can choose the destination from a dropdown menu filled with pre-configured SAP BTP destinations. The field allows for quick search. As you type, a dropdown shows filtered results, making it simple to find the desired destination

If the destination name is not specified on the Settings page, the system will automatically check for the existence of the default destination name,  "PaPM_CloudALM," in SAP BTP. The system will also check for the default destination if the user attempts to save an empty destination field. If the default destination is created in SAP BTP, it will be populated in the field. If it is not defined, the field will remain empty.

We have added a field under the Application Shell Integration Settings section where you can add your SAP Cloud ALM link.

When you add a link for SAP Cloud ALM under the Application Shell Integration Settings section, a new tile will be activated in the app switcher on the Shell Page, from which the user can access the SAP Cloud ALM application.

For more information, visit  Settings in the Application Help Portal.  

For more information on integrating SAP Cloud ALM with SAP Profitability and Performance Management and creating a destination for it in SAP BTP, visit  SAP Cloud ALM Setup in the Administration Guide.

That is all! If you want to monitor and recall what are the new features and updates from SAP PaPM Cloud - Standard Model, you may follow the tag PaPMCloudSMWhatsNew thank you for reading!

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud SM: Mass Upload of Process Instances
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community members! 

I'm excited to share the improvements made to the Process Management screen in SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud Standard Model (SAP PaPM Cloud SM). To improve efficiency when working with complex processes that contain a large number of similar activities, a new functionality has been introduced: Mass Upload of Process Settings. This feature enables users to download the configuration of existing process instances in the form of an XLSX file, make changes in required sheets, and then upload those changes back into the application to create multiple new instances simultaneously. 

Two new buttons have been added to the top toolbar – Download Process Settings and Upload Process Settings. The first enables users to download the configuration of existing instances as a template for further use, while the second is used for uploading a prepared XLSX file with new process instances. 

Downloading Process Instances 

To download the configuration of an existing process instance, select one or more instances from the list and click the Download Process Settings button. If only one instance is selected, a single XLSX file containing its configuration will be downloaded. In case multiple instances are selected, a ZIP file containing one XLSX file per instance will be downloaded.  

The name of the downloaded file will include the environment ID, version, and process instance ID, for example, RPM_TS05_PROC07.  

Each XLSX file has the same structure and includes five sheets:  

  • Process - Contains general information about process instances, including the following columns: Process, Description, Process Type, Process State, and Start Date. 
  • Activities - Contains information about activities from selected process instances, including the following columns: Process, Activity, Description, Performer, Reviewer, Start Date, and End Date.
  • Parameters - Contains information about defined parameters with the following columns: Process, Field, and Value.
  • Selections - Contains information about the defined selection with the following columns: Process, Selection Field, Logical Operator, Operator Type, Selection Min. Value and Selection Max. Values. For selections that don't require a minimum and maximum value, the value under Selection Min. Value will be taken as the selection value during upload.
  • Help - Provides additional information that might be useful when configuring the other four tabs. This tab is not considered during the upload process. 

While the structure and column order are always the same, the row content varies depending on which instance is selected – i.e., which activities, parameters, and selections it contains. 

Configuration of the XLSX file: 

  1. The XLSX file must maintain its structure exactly without changing the order of the columns, otherwise, the content cannot be placed correctly. 
  2. The Process State field on the Process sheet and the Logical Operator and Operator Type fields on the Selections sheet have dropdown menus, allowing you to easily select predefined available options. You can find more information about these values on the Help sheet. 
  3. The uploaded file should only contain activity, parameters and selections that exist and are active in the target process instance. If an XLSX file contains some elements that are not defined in the target process template, the upload process will be canceled. 
  4. If any elements (parameters, process selections, activities) that are part of the process template are not mentioned in the XLSX file, they will be copied from the target process instance. 
  5. If a field is defined in the Parameter or Selection sheet but has no value, it will be configured as an empty field. 
  6. Data is linked to the Process ID in the first column of each sheet. Rows with the same Process ID will be used to create a single process instance, and subsequent rows will be used accordingly. 
  7. The maximum number of process instances that can be uploaded within a single XLSX file is 50. If you exceed this limit, the system will automatically cancel the upload and display an appropriate error message. 

Uploading Process Instances 

Once you have finished configuring new instances in the XLSX file, the next step is to upload the file back into the PaPM application. On the Process Management screen, you first need to select one base instance, either the one for which you downloaded process settings or another instance with the same configuration, meaning using the same process template, so they contain the same Activity, Parameters and Selection fields. Clicking the Upload Process Settings button opens a file upload dialog, where you select the XLSX file that was configured in the previous steps. After confirming, the application will create new instances based on the data from all four tabs. 

It is important to note that the upload will not be successful if there is any error in the data, even if just one instance in the file is invalid, the entire upload process will be canceled, and no instances will be created. In such cases, a red toast message will appear, notifying you of the failure. For more details about the error, refer to the Message Log. 

Note: For the value field, no data validation will occur during the upload process, meaning the value field will not be checked if the values satisfy the defined configuration for that field. The process instance will be uploaded successfully without displaying any warning messages. This type of error can only be seen after uploading and expanding specific process instances, parameters, or selections, depending on where the error is present.   

The new Mass Upload of Process Settings functionality significantly speeds up the configuration of multiple similar processes, reduces manual work, and enables better standardization in the SAP PaPM Cloud SM environment. 

I hope you find these updates helpful!  

Stay tuned for the latest updates and insights in the next one. Thank you!

entry.title: SAP PaPM Post-Installation – ABAP Steps
entry.content:
Introduction 

Hello everyone, 

Have you ever tried buying a new phone that includes a manual that teaches you how to set up the device? Did you try to follow it through and perform the steps provided? In PaPM, there is also a manual that will guide you through the steps required after the installation of SAP Profitability and Performance Management 3.0. This procedure is called post-installation and will help you ensure that the application works in the live client where the system is activated. 

We have three parts of post-installation: 

  • ABAP steps 
  • HANA steps 
  • Default environment steps 

You need to perform manual steps after a successful installation of SAP Profitability and Performance Management 3.0 or a support package update to ensure the application works consistently. 

 

ABAP Steps 

The ABAP steps you need to carry out depend on your individual situation: 
For a newly installed SAP Profitability and Performance Management 3.0 system, you need to perform the steps from Support Package 01 up to the latest patch level installed in the system. 

For a Support Package update, ensure you perform the steps mentioned in the newly implemented Support Packages. 

Note: If you were originally on SP07 and then move to SP19, you need to perform all the steps required for SP08, SP09, SP10, SP11, SP12, SP13, SP14, SP15, SP16, SP17, SP18, and SP19. 

 

Set Namespaces 

This step is a cross-client activity that can be performed in any active client within the system where SAP Profitability and Performance Management is installed. In SAP Profitability and Performance Management there are certain namespaces that need to be set to “modifiable” up until SP13. From SP14 onwards, this is no longer necessary and can be skipped  

Possible issues when not performed: 
You may encounter activation issues with the system prompting you to set the namespace to modifiable. You will also encounter issues during transport when after-import has initiated the activation/generation of objects.  

More information: 
PaPM is customizing. Activation in PaPM does not just involve SE38 inactive report -- it involves a creation of artifacts as well (function Ytables, procedures, process chains, queries, and so on). Therefore, ensure you follow the steps described in the Administration Guide under Set Namespaces. 

 

Establish Database Connection 

This step is a cross-client activity that can be performed in any active client within the system where SAP Profitability and Performance Management is installed. You can specify the database connection name within the environment settings in SAP Profitability and Performance Management.  

From SP22 onwards, you can make use of the DEFAULT database connection already available in Netweaver ABAP. You no longer need to create a DBCON database connection. All the sample content environments from SP22 onwards use the DEFAULT database connection. 

If you have already established the DBCON database connection for previous support packages in your environment, you can continue using them or you can change all your environments to use the DEFAULT connection. 

 

Create RFC Destination 

This step is a cross-client activity that can be performed in any active client within the system where SAP Profitability and Performance Management is installed. 

The default naming convention for the RFC destination is “<System_ID>CLNT<Client>”. For example, “PERCLNT100”, where “PER” is the system ID and “100” is the client on which you want to configure SAP Profitability and Performance Management functions. By following this naming convention, you will not need to apply any additional settings in the system. However, if your system landscape requires you to use a different name for the RFC destination, you need to register the new name in the Connection Management application with connection source “After Import”. For more information about maintaining connections to external systems, see the Connection Management section in the Application Help for SAP Profitability and Performance Management. 

Possible issues when not performed: 
You may encounter issues during transport.  

For more information, see Create RFC Destination. 

 

Create Local SAP System Alias 

Since SAP Profitability and Performance Management or NXI services need to be assigned to a local SAP Gateway named “LOCAL”, it is mandatory to have this created in the system where SAP Profitability and Performance Management is being activated. 

The system alias is the result of the routing for an inbound request on SAP Gateway and it can be a remote or a local system. If the system alias is flagged as a local SAP GW instance, it means that the system that is responsible for processing (managing and storing) the data of an inbound request is the local SAP Gateway instance itself. Therefore, testing this item is leaning more on connection settings related to activation of NXI services. 

For more information, see Creating an SAP System Alias. 

 

Create Semantic Object 

Semantic objects are delivered in the underlying SAP_UI component SPs. The semantic object of SAP Profitability and Performance Management will be delivered in SAP_UI 750 SP12. If your system is already patched to SAP_UI 750 SP12, the semantic object of SAP Profitability and Performance Management is automatically available. 

Note:  
If your system is on SAP_UI 750 SP10 or SAP_UI 750 SP11, you need to create the semantic object of SAP Profitability and Performance Management in every system where you want to use the SAP Fiori apps for SAP Profitability and Performance Management. 

For more information on the procedure, see Create Semantic Object. 

 

Activate Deep HANA Integration 

Note that in SAP BW/4HANA systems, Deep HANA integration is switched on by default. You can go to transaction SE11 and enter the table name RSPLS_HDB_ACT to see the entries. Since this is a cross-client activity, you can do this in any client within the system where SAP Profitability and Performance Management is installed. To do so, follow the procedure described in Activate Deep HANA Integration. 

Possible issues when not performed: 
The maintenance dialog for RSPLS_HDB_ACT is incomplete or not defined. 

Message no. SV037 

Diagnosis 
The called function with the view/table RSPLS_HDB_ACT needs a special maintenance dialog which, however, either does not exist at all, or does not exist completely. 

System Response 
The called function cannot be performed. 

 

Set Number Range Intervals 

This step must be performed for every client in the system where SAP Profitability and Performance Management is used. 

Before operating SAP Profitability and Performance Management, set the number range intervals for the following number range objects using transaction SNRO. Ensure that you enter “01” in the No. column (not just “1”). 

For the Process ID object, maintaining the number range interval is optional. It is only required if you want the system to suggest the process ID automatically during the creation of the process instance. 

Note: 
The number range intervals listed below are reserved for the SAP sample content. To avoid duplicate ID errors, make sure that the number range intervals listed below are not used: 

Possible issues when not performed: 
Transporting environments across systems/clients where number range interval definitions for /NXI/* number range objects are identical could lead to serious inconsistencies. When you are setting up the landscape, you therefore need to make sure that the number range intervals do not overlap and are unique. 

 

Activate All NXI Services 

This step is a cross-client setup that must be revisited for every support package update activity. In SAP Profitability and Performance Management, there are specific NXI services that need to be activated before you can use applications under Modeling, Execution, and System Reports. 

Note: 
Since PaPM is accessed via browser, these webdynpro, bsp, ui5_ui5, OData should all be activated. 

For more information on the procedure, see Activate All NXI Services. 

 

Assign SAP System Alias to NXI Services 

The local SAP system alias created in the previous step must be assigned to all NXI services. 

For more information on the procedure, see Assign SAP System Alias to NXI Services. 

Possible issues when not performed: 
You may encounter dump like “500 Internal Server Error” when launching My Environments or any PaPM application. 

 

Publish OData Services 

To integrate the processing service, you need to publish the service group following the steps in Publish OData Services. 

 

Adjust Maximum Record Length (RADTBCON viewlen) 

This step is a cross-client activity that can be performed in any active client within the system where SAP Profitability and Performance Management is installed. 

Note: 
If your system is on SAP_BASIS version 753 (for example, BW/4HANA 2.0 or S/4HANA 1909) and above, you can skip this step. 

If you intend to import the sample content or use SAP Profitability and Performance Management with a record length greater than 4030, perform the following steps in Adjust Maximum Record Length (RADTBCON viewlen). 

Possible issues when not performed: 
PaPM function table activation is failing when total length of all the fields exceeds more than 4030. Error: table Y032PUD000 is too long >4030 
msg: Y032PUD000 -> no 4030 -> no relevant 

 

Adjust Maximum Record Length (RADTBCON tablen) 

This step is a cross-client activity that can be performed in any active client within the system where SAP Profitability and Performance Management is installed. 

Note: 
If your system is on SAP_BASIS version 753 (for example, BW/4HANA 2.0 or S/4HANA 1909) and above, you can skip this step. 

If you intend to import the sample content or use SAP Profitability and Performance Management with a record length greater than 4030, perform the following steps in Adjust Maximum Record Length (RADTBCON tablen). 

 

Maintain User Groups 

To enable individual users to use the Manage and Deploy Processes application, you need to assign them to a user group. 

For more information, see Maintain User Groups. 

Possible issues when not performed: 
You will not be able to see the process instance and activities created.  

 

Migrate Models 

This step is valid when patching to SAP Profitability and Performance Management 3.0 SP04 onwards. 

An enhanced UI for models with sync and mapping functionalities is available. Run the migration report /NXI/P1_MIGRATE_MODELS to activate functions configured with the old UI. 

Proceed with the steps in Migrate Models. 

 

Set Up Dual Control for Usage in Process Execution (Optional) 

If you intend to use the dual control functionality (with performers and reviewers) including email notification when you run processes or activities, you need to set up the basic workflow and perform the SAPconnect administration or check that this has already been done. 

For more information about the basic workflow setup, see Automatic Workflow Customizing. 

 

Implement Important SAP Notes 

Users should be able to implement important SAP Notes. 

Possible issues when not performed: 
You may encounter issues when running the Writer function. 

You need this also to achieve the Editable Visual Modeler. 

For more information, see Implement Important SAP Notes. 

 

Create Tool BW Client 

To integrate SAP Profitability and Performance Management with BW, you can activate the BW client in the following scenarios: 

  • In a different client than SAP Profitability and Performance Management (for example, the BW is in client 100; SAP Profitability and Performance Management is in client 200, but in the same system) 
  • In the same client as SAP Profitability and Performance Management (for example, BW and SAP Profitability and Performance Management are both in client 200). 

For more information on the procedure, see Create Tool BW Client. 

Note: 
You need to recheck the RSADMINA table in transaction code SE16 of the BI Client and verify that BW_USER, BWMANDT, BWMANDTRFC, and TPBWMANDTRFC are properly populated. 

 

Adjust RSADMINA Table (Column TPBWMANDTRFC) 

In the live client for SAP Profitability and Performance Management, assign the BW RFC destination to the TPBWMANDTRFC column in the RSADMINA table. 

For more information on the procedure, see Adjust RSADMINA Table (Column TPBWMANDTRFC). 

Note: 
For additional information about how to modify the RSADMINA table, see SAP Notes 1949194 and 1911225. 

 

Create SAP HANA Source System 

There are two ways to create the source system:  

  • Via BW Client  
  • Via SAP HANA Studio 

For BW Client, follow the steps in Create SAP HANA Source System.  
For SAP HANA Studio, follow the steps in Create SAP HANA Source System.  

Possible issues when not performed: 
You may encounter issues like logical systems for a particular database schema does not exist. 

Note: 
If you configure the Model Table function and Model View function in the environments of SAP Profitability and Performance Management to point to sources from other schemas, you also need to carry out the steps listed above for every schema. 

 

Activate Planning Function Type 

This activity is to be performed in the client where BW has been activated. To do this, follow the procedure in Activate Planning Function Type. 

Possible issues when not performed: 
You may encounter issues with the Writer function or cannot create ADSO InfoProvider, Model BW.  

 

Activate Query Element Variables 

This activity needs to be performed in the client where BW has been activated. To do this, follow the procedure in Activate Planning Function Type. 

Now we are already done with the ABAP Steps, we can already proceed with the other blogpost that tackles the HANA and default environment steps. You can check it through this link.

entry.title: SAP PaPM Post-Installation – HANA Steps
entry.content:
Introduction 

The first part of this blog covers only the ABAP steps. In this second part, we will discuss the HANA steps and default environment steps. 

We have three parts of post-installation: 

  • ABAP steps 
  • HANA steps 
  • Default environment steps 

HANA Steps 

The steps in this section need to be performed in SAP HANA Studio. 

The HANA steps you need to carry out depend on your individual situation: 

  • For a newly installed SAP Profitability and Performance Management 3.0 system, you need to perform the steps from Support Package 01 up to the latest patch level installed in the system. 
  • For a Support Package update, ensure you perform the steps mentioned in the newly implemented Support Packages.  

Note: If you were originally on SP07 and then moved to SP19, you need to perform all the steps required for SP08, SP09, SP10, SP11, SP12, SP13, SP14, SP15, SP16, SP17, SP18, and SP19. 

 

Create NXI Schema in SAP HANA Studio 

The steps in this section need to be performed in SAP HANA Studio. Follow the steps in the procedure section in Create NXI Schema in SAP HANA Studio. 

Possible issues when not performed: 
You will not be able to activate all modeling functions as the required procedure cannot be generated if this step was not performed.
